intro: Pentace grandiflora, commonly known as the African velvet tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a distinctive, smooth, often waxy bark and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
